page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: Most of the farming in the area concerns livestock as the hilly nature of the land is best for this type of farming. A few dairies are to be found such as Robinsland (square 15,51) but much of the land is only suitable for sheep, In the 1960's traditional breeds eg. Hereford,Aberdeen Angus and the Short horn were replaced by the more economical foreign breeds such as the British Charlois, Romanolga and the Limousin. These are more economical as being bigger produce more meat. The most common breed of sheep is the Blackface. The common sire for the fat lambs is the Suffolk. Blackfaced ewes are often crossed with Leicesters. Ewe lambs of this cross are kept and bred with the Suffolk which results in fat lambs.
